com.jme.opencl.Image

    Package Description
    com.jme.opencl  

    • Uses of Image in com.jme.opencl

      Methods in com.jme.opencl that return Image 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      abstract Image Context.bindImage​(Image image, Texture.Type textureType, int miplevel, MemoryAccess access)
      Creates a shared image object from a jME3-image.
      Image Context.bindImage​(Texture texture, int miplevel, MemoryAccess access)
      Creates a shared image object from a jME3 texture.
      Image Context.bindImage​(Texture texture, MemoryAccess access)
      Alternative version to Context.bindImage(com.jme.texture.Texture, int, com.jme.opencl.MemoryAccess), uses miplevel=0.
      protected abstract Image Context.bindPureRenderBuffer​(FrameBuffer.RenderBuffer buffer, MemoryAccess access)  
      Image Context.bindRenderBuffer​(FrameBuffer.RenderBuffer buffer, MemoryAccess access)
      Creates a shared image object from a jME3 render buffer.
      abstract Image Context.createImage​(MemoryAccess access, Image.ImageFormat format, Image.ImageDescriptor descr)
      Creates a new 1D, 2D, 3D image.
      ImageFormat specifies the element type and order, like RGBA of floats.
      ImageDescriptor specifies the dimension of the image.
      Furthermore, a ByteBuffer can be specified in the ImageDescriptor together with row and slice pitches.
      Image Image.register()  
      Methods in com.jme.opencl with parameters of type Image 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      abstract void Image.copyTo​(CommandQueue queue, Image dest, long[] srcOrigin, long[] destOrigin, long[] region)
      Performs a blocking copy operation from one image to another.
      abstract Event Image.copyToAsync​(CommandQueue queue, Image dest, long[] srcOrigin, long[] destOrigin, long[] region)
      Performs an async/non-blocking copy operation from one image to another.
      abstract Event Buffer.copyToImageAsync​(CommandQueue queue, Image dest, long srcOffset, long[] destOrigin, long[] destRegion)
      Copies this buffer to the specified image.
      abstract void Kernel.setArg​(int index, Image i)
